Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface NodeFactory

All Known Subinterfaces:
GraphFactory
All Known Implementing Classes:
ALGraphFactory, GraphFactoryAdapter, NodeFactoryAdapter, SimpleTreeFactory, TreeGraphFactory
public interface NodeFactory

A factory to create Nodes in an appropriate way. cf. GraphFactory for the rationale behind factories.

A factory manages a list of graphs, i.e. every time a new node is created, it is added to all its associated graphs. Removal of nodes is managed at the graph level. To build different graphs, you must use a different factory for each of them or carefully manage insertion of nodes and edges into the graphs using the manageGraph(...) and unmanageGraph(...) methods.

Implementing classes must have a constructor taking a IdentityScope as a parameter, or internally building a Scope, to guarantee unicity of node IDs.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux 7-11-2018

  • Field Details

    • defaultNodeId

      static final String defaultNodeId
      A default node identifier (e.g. to start a LocalScope)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • makeNode

      default Node makeNode()
      Create a node with no properties. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The instance ID is automatically generated and is unique within the scope of this factory.
      Returns:
      the new Node instance

    • makeNode

      default Node makeNode​(ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
      Create a node with properties. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The instance ID is automatically generated and is unique within the scope of this factory.
      Parameters:
      props - properties
      Returns:
      the new Node instance

    • makeNode

      Node makeNode​(String proposedId)
      Create a node with no properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
      Parameters:
      proposedId - the instance identifier
      Returns:
      the new Node instance

    • makeNode

      Node makeNode​(String proposedId, ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
      Create a node with properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the default (= the implementing class name). The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
      Parameters:
      proposedId - the instance identifier
      props - properties
      Returns:
      the new Node instance

    • nodeClassName

      default String nodeClassName​(Class<? extends Node> nodeClass)
      Factories may use labels (= just Strings), as aliases for Node descendant class names. This method returns the label of a node class as known by this factory.
      Parameters:
      nodeClass - the node class
      Returns:
      the node class label recorded in this factory. Defaults to Class.getSimpleName().

    • nodeClass

      default Class<? extends Node> nodeClass​(String label)
      Factories may use labels (= just Strings), as aliases for Node descendant class names. This method returns the class type matching a node label. Default behaviour is to pretend that label is a class name in the package fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.
      Parameters:
      label - the label to get the class associated to it
      Returns:
      the class name matching the label argument

    • makeNode

      Node makeNode​(Class<? extends Node> nodeClass, String proposedId, ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
      Create a node of a particular sub-class with properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
      Parameters:
      nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
      proposedId - the instance identifier
      props - properties
      Returns:
      the new Node instance, null if construction failed

    • makeNode

      Node makeNode​(Class<? extends Node> nodeClass, String proposedId)
      Create a node of a particular sub-class with no properties and a proposed ID. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The proposed ID is checked for unicity within the scope of this factory, and if not, is modified appropriately to be unique. Therefore, the returned instance may have a unique ID different from the one proposed as an argument.
      Parameters:
      nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
      proposedId - the instance identifier
      Returns:
      the new Node instance, null if construction failed

    • makeNode

      default Node makeNode​(Class<? extends Node> nodeClass, ReadOnlyPropertyList props)
      Create a node of a particular sub-class with properties. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The instance ID is automatically generated and is unique within the scope of this factory.
      Parameters:
      nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
      props - properties
      Returns:
      the new Node instance, null if construction failed

    • makeNode

      default Node makeNode​(Class<? extends Node> nodeClass)
      Create a node of a particular sub-class with no properties. The class ID is set to the implementing class name or, if recorded in this factory, to its label. The instance ID is automatically generated and is unique within the scope of this factory.
      Parameters:
      nodeClass - the Node implementation to use to create this instance
      Returns:
      the new Node instance, null if construction failed

    • manageGraph

      void manageGraph​(NodeSet<? extends Node> graph)
      Associate a graph instance to this factory. Further instances created by calls to one of the makeNode(...) methods will be added into this graph.
      Parameters:
      graph - the Graph or Tree instance to manage

    • unmanageGraph

      void unmanageGraph​(NodeSet<? extends Node> graph)
      Dissociate a graph instance from this factory. Further instances created by calls to one of the makeNode(...) methods will no more be added into this graph.
      Parameters:
      graph - the Graph or Tree instance to manage

    • nodePropertyFactory

      default PropertyListFactory nodePropertyFactory()
      Accessor to the PropertyListFactory associated to this factory.
      Returns:
      the propertyListfactory used with this NodeFactory
